name: {{full_name_from_external_file}}
subtitle: Machine Learning • Computer Vision • Text-to-Speech
hero_title: I build solutions powered by Machine Learning and speech generation
hero_subtitle: I specialize in Computer Vision (YOLO detection & pose), Text-to-Speech systems and RVC models. I build tools, experiments and prototypes focused on practical ML applications.
about_text: I am a student at WZIM SGGW, majoring in Cloud Technologies. I work on speech generation systems and their integration with RVC (Retrieval-based Voice Conversion). My interests lie in practical ML applications — especially Computer Vision (YOLO detection, YOLO pose), audio processing and Text-to-Speech. I also have experience creating web applications: frontend with Angular and backend with Django. As a hobby, I produce and mix audio: I record and mix multi-instrument tracks and vocals in Reaper and perform mastering. I also use tools like UVR (Universal Vocal Removal) for voice separation — I often record amateur vocal covers to practice vocal mixing of non-professional voices.
kronos_desc: Live frontend demo of Kronos — shows stops, vehicles and live delays.

projects.title: Kronos — Live buses & trams delays
projects.short_description: Live demo of bus & tram delays — a Kronos frontend showing stops, vehicles and live timetable delays.
projects.long_description: Kronos is a custom delay engine powering a live web frontend for public transport. This Angular frontend lists stops, shows upcoming vehicles for each stop, and displays a vehicle route along with live delays derived from official timetables and observed delay statistics. The backend engine (Django) is maintained separately.

projects.title: Integration of AllTalk TTS with RVC
projects.short_description: A system combining speech generation (AllTalk TTS) with RVC voice conversion in near real-time.
projects.long_description: The project includes a full processing pipeline: TTS generation, audio preprocessing, training and fine-tuning RVC models, and integration with a user interface. It uses audio analysis tools, and includes a video demonstration.

projects.title: Automatic TikTok Clip Generator from Long-form Content
projects.short_description: Tool that analyzes long videos, detects interesting moments and generates TikTok-ready clips.
projects.long_description: The system uses LLM transcription to detect noteworthy segments in long-form content, automatically cuts fragments, adapts them to the correct aspect ratio, adds subtitles, and outputs ready-to-publish clips — ideal for TikTok / social media sharing.

projects.title: Hearing Asymmetry Checker (WPF)
projects.short_description: Desktop tool for checking which ear is more sensitive to certain frequencies.
projects.long_description: The application generates audio tones with adjustable frequency and volume, enabling the user to determine sensitivity differences between left and right ear. Created as a simple tool for amateur hearing asymmetry analysis.

projects.title: Collection of ML Tools and Scripts
projects.short_description: Set of small utilities and scripts supporting ML, CV and audio experiments.
projects.long_description: Various tools for data preprocessing, quick model testing, file conversion and basic image/audio analysis. Many were created to support ML research, as well as TTS and RVC audio processing.

experience.description: During the internship I worked on an application for editing SVG files used to generate EU Power Labels. The project included dynamic placement of energy categories, automatic pointer movement, value updates and visual adjustments. Implementation was based on C# and manipulation of the SVG structure.
